ChatGPT said:

Perfect â€” letâ€™s define the two models in your prisma/schema.prisma file. Here's the clean, multilingual-ready Prisma schema for your service_plans and service_plan_features:

âœ… prisma/schema.prisma

prisma
model ServicePlan {
  id          Int                    @id @default(autoincrement())
  title       String
  price       Decimal
  description String
  language    String                 // 'en', 'es', or 'el'
  order       Int
  createdAt   DateTime              @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime              @updatedAt

  features    ServicePlanFeature[]
}

model ServicePlanFeature {
  id             Int          @id @default(autoincrement())
  name           String
  servicePlanId  Int
  createdAt      DateTime     @default(now())
  updatedAt      DateTime     @updatedAt

  servicePlan    ServicePlan  @relation(fields: [servicePlanId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
}

ðŸ›  Notes:

  • @updatedAt ensures updatedAt is refreshed automatically on updates.

  • Decimal for price handles accurate monetary values.

  • The language field uses simple strings (en, es, el) â€” can be later replaced with enum if needed.

  • We use onDelete: Cascade so deleting a service plan also deletes its features automatically.

ðŸŸ¢ Next Steps:

  1. Migrate the database:

bash
npx prisma migrate dev --name create_service_plans

  1. Seed sample data (optional â€” I can help generate a seed file with English service plans based on your old content).

  2. Build API routes:

  • /api/service-plans (GET all by language)

  • /api/admin/service-plans (POST, PUT, DELETE for admin panel)

Would you like me to create the seed file next or start with the API routes?

ChatGPT said:

Great question â€” and you're thinking like a true backend dev now ðŸ‘

âœ… Can You Separate Prisma Models into Multiple Files?

By default, Prisma only supports a single schema.prisma file.
So all models (User, ServicePlan, ServicePlanFeature, etc.) must live in the same file.

ðŸ§© But What You Can Do (Recommended Practice)

To stay clean and modular, you can:

  • Keep models in schema.prisma (as required),

  • But organize logic separately:

    • Create prisma/models/ folder (optional for future codegen or code organization).

    • Keep API logic or model helper functions separate in your lib or services folder.

âœ… Your Updated schema.prisma (merged with ServicePlan models)

prisma
generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model User {
  id        Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  email     String   @unique
  name      String?
  createdAt DateTime @default(now())
}

model ServicePlan {
  id          Int                    @id @default(autoincrement())
  title       String
  price       Decimal
  description String
  language    String                 // 'en', 'es', or 'el'
  order       Int
  createdAt   DateTime              @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime              @updatedAt

  features    ServicePlanFeature[]
}

model ServicePlanFeature {
  id             Int          @id @default(autoincrement())
  name           String
  servicePlanId  Int
  createdAt      DateTime     @default(now())
  updatedAt      DateTime     @updatedAt

  servicePlan    ServicePlan  @relation(fields: [servicePlanId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
}

âœ… Most Professional & Modern: ES Modules (import/export + "type": "module")

Using import/export and enabling ES Modules via:

json
"type": "module"

in your package.json is considered the modern standard in JavaScript and Node.js (since v14+).

Why?

  • Matches the module system in all modern frontend frameworks (like Next.js).

  • Aligns your backend and frontend style (both use import).

  • Easier to share code and utility functions across frontend/backend (especially in full-stack projects).

  • Prepares your project for modern tooling and future compatibility.

âœ… STEP 1: Create API route

Create the file:
ðŸ“ /app/api/service-plans/route.js

js
import { PrismaClient } from '@prisma/client'

const prisma = new PrismaClient()

export async function GET(request) {
  const { searchParams } = new URL(request.url)
  const lang = searchParams.get('lang') || 'en'

  try {
    const plans = await prisma.servicePlan.findMany({
      where: { language: lang },
      orderBy: { order: 'asc' },
      include: { features: true }
    })

    return new Response(JSON.stringify(plans), {
      status: 200,
      headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }
    })
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('[GET /api/service-plans] Error:', error)
    return new Response(JSON.stringify({ error: 'Failed to fetch service plans' }), {
      status: 500
    })
  }
}

ðŸ§  Notes:

  • Uses Prisma to query the database

  • Filters plans by language (default: 'en')

  • Sorts them by order as you requested

  • Includes all features per plan

'use client'
import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react'
import './ServicePlans.css'
import { translations } from './translations'
import { motion } from 'framer-motion'

const ServicePlans = ({ lang = 'en' }) => {
  const [plans, setPlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${lang}`)
        const data = await res.json()
        const sorted = data.sort((a, b) => a.order - b.order)
        setPlans(sorted)
      } catch (err) {
        console.error('Failed to load service plans:', err)
        setPlans([])
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [lang])

  return (
    <section className="service-plans-section">
      <h2 className="section-title">{translations[lang]?.title}</h2>

      {loading ? (
        <p className="service-loading">{translations[lang]?.loading}</p>
      ) : plans.length === 0 ? (
        <p className="service-empty">{translations[lang]?.empty}</p>
      ) : (
        <div className="plans-grid">
          {plans.map((plan, index) => (
            <motion.div
              key={plan.id}
              className="plan-card"
              initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 30 }}
              animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
              transition={{ delay: index * 0.1, duration: 0.4 }}
            >
              <div className="card-header">
                <span className="plan-emoji">{plan.title.slice(0, 2)}</span>
                <h3 className="plan-title">{plan.title.slice(2)}</h3>
                <div className="plan-price">â‚¬{plan.price}</div>
              </div>
              <p className="plan-description">{plan.description}</p>
              <ul className="plan-features">
                {plan.features.map(feature => (
                  <li key={feature.id}>â€¢ {feature.name}</li>
                ))}
              </ul>
              <button className="plan-cta">
                {translations[lang]?.button}
              </button>
            </motion.div>

âœ… STEP 1: ServicePlanCarousel.jsx

ðŸ“ Path: components/home/servicecarousel/ServicePlanCarousel.jsx

jsx
'use client'
import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import { useInView } from 'react-intersection-observer'
import './ServicePlanCarousel.css'
import { translations } from './translations'
import Link from 'next/link'

const ServicePlanCarousel = ({ lang = 'en' }) => {
  const [plans, setPlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const sliderRef = useRef(null)
  const { ref: titleRef, inView } = useInView({ threshold: 0.2 })

  // Fetch plans by language
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${lang}`)
        const data = await res.json()
        setPlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError('Failed to load service plans.')
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [lang])

  // Auto slide every 2 seconds
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) sliderRef.current.slickNext()
    }, 2000)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  const settings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1040, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } }
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <div className="carousel-loading">{translations[lang].loading}</div>
  if (error) return <div className="carousel-error">{error}</div>
  if (plans.length === 0) return <div className="carousel-empty">{translations[lang].empty}</div>

  return (
    <section className="carousel-section">
      <h2 className={`carousel-title ${inView ? 'animate' : ''}`} ref={titleRef}>
        {translations[lang].title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {plans.map((plan, index) => (
          <div key={plan.id} className={`carousel-card bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`}>
            <div className="carousel-content">
              <h3 className="carousel-plan-title">{plan.title}</h3>
              <p className="carousel-plan-desc">{plan.description}</p>
              <Link href="/services" className="carousel-button">
                {translations[lang].button}
              </Link>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </Slider>
    </section>
  )
}

export default ServicePlanCarousel

  const handleScroll = () => {
    if (titleRef.current) {
      const rect = titleRef.current.getBoundingClientRect();
      if (rect.top <= window.innerHeight * 0.9) {
        setAnimateTitle(true);
      }
    }
  };

  window.addEventListener('scroll', handleScroll);
  handleScroll(); // trigger once
  return () => window.removeEventListener('scroll', handleScroll);
}, []);

Absolutely! Here's the full updated ServicePlanCarousel.jsx file with:

  • âœ… Scroll-based animation (no react-intersection-observer)

  • âœ… Auto-sliding slick carousel

  • âœ… Multilingual title

  • âœ… Clean fallback messages

âœ… src/app/home/servicecarousel/ServicePlanCarousel.jsx

jsx
'use client';

import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef, useMemo } from 'react';
import Slider from 'react-slick';
import './ServicePlanCarousel.css';
import { translations } from './translations';
import Link from 'next/link';

const ServicePlanCarousel = ({ language = 'en' }) => {
  const [servicePlans, setServicePlans] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const [error, setError] = useState('');
  const sliderRef = useRef(null);
  const titleRef = useRef(null);
  const [animateTitle, setAnimateTitle] = useState(false);

  // âœ… Scroll-based title animation
  useEffect(() => {
    const handleScroll = () => {
      if (titleRef.current) {
        const rect = titleRef.current.getBoundingClientRect();
        if (rect.top <= window.innerHeight * 0.9) {
          setAnimateTitle(true);
        }
      }
    };

    window.addEventListener('scroll', handleScroll);
    handleScroll(); // trigger on mount
    return () => window.removeEventListener('scroll', handleScroll);
  }, []);

  // âœ… Fetch service plans
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      setLoading(true);
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${language}`);
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch');
        const data = await res.json();
        setServicePlans(data);
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message || 'Error loading service plans');
      } finally {
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };
    fetchData();
  }, [language]);

  // âœ… Auto-slide settings
  const sliderSettings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1040, settings: { slidesToShow: 2, slidesToScroll: 1 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1, slidesToScroll: 1 } },
    ],
  }), []);

  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext();
      }
    }, 2500);
    return () => clearInterval(interval);
  }, []);

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-loading">Loading service plans...</p>;
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-error">Error: {error}</p>;
  if (servicePlans.length === 0) return <p className="carousel-empty">No service plans available</p>;

  return (
    <div className="carousel-section">
      <h2
        ref={titleRef}
        className={`carousel-title ${animateTitle ? 'animate' : ''}`}
      >
        {translations[language]?.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...sliderSettings}>
        {servicePlans
          .sort((a, b) => a.order - b.order)
          .map((plan, index) => {
            const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`;
            return (
              <div className={`carousel-card ${bgClass}`} key={plan.id}>
                <div className="carousel-content">
                  <h3 className="carousel-plan-title">{plan.title}</h3>
                  <p className="carousel-plan-desc">{plan.description}</p>
                  <Link href="/services" className="carousel-button">
                    {translations[language]?.button}
                  </Link>
                </div>
              </div>
            );
          })}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  );
};

ChatGPT said:

Perfect â€” here's your fully updated ServicePlanCarousel.jsx component:

  • âœ… Dynamically loads translations (loading, empty, button, title)

  • âœ… Filters service plans by selected language

  • âœ… Clean fallback messages if no plans exist

  • âœ… Animation and carousel logic intact

âœ… Updated ServicePlanCarousel.jsx

jsx
'use client';

import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef, useMemo } from 'react';
import Slider from 'react-slick';
import './ServicePlanCarousel.css';
import { translations } from './translations';
import Link from 'next/link';

const ServicePlanCarousel = ({ language = 'en' }) => {
  const [servicePlans, setServicePlans] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const [error, setError] = useState('');
  const sliderRef = useRef(null);
  const titleRef = useRef(null);
  const [animateTitle, setAnimateTitle] = useState(false);

  // Title animation on scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    const handleScroll = () => {
      if (titleRef.current) {
        const rect = titleRef.current.getBoundingClientRect();
        if (rect.top <= window.innerHeight * 0.9) {
          setAnimateTitle(true);
        }
      }
    };

    window.addEventListener('scroll', handleScroll);
    handleScroll();
    return () => window.removeEventListener('scroll', handleScroll);
  }, []);

  // Fetch service plans by selected language
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      setLoading(true);
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${language}`);
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch');
        const data = await res.json();
        setServicePlans(data);
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message || 'Error loading service plans');
      } finally {
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };
    fetchData();
  }, [language]);

  // Carousel settings
  const sliderSettings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1040, settings: { slidesToShow: 2, slidesToScroll: 1 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1, slidesToScroll: 1 } },
    ],
  }), []);

  // Auto slide
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext();
      }
    }, 2500);
    return () => clearInterval(interval);
  }, []);

  const t = translations[language] || translations.en;

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-loading">{t.loading}</p>;
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-error">Error: {error}</p>;
  if (servicePlans.length === 0) return <p className="carousel-empty">{t.empty}</p>;

  return (
    <div className="carousel-section">
      <h2
        ref={titleRef}
        className={`carousel-title ${animateTitle ? 'animate' : ''}`}
      >
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...sliderSettings}>
        {servicePlans
          .sort((a, b) => a.order - b.order)
          .map((plan, index) => {
            const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`;
            return (
              <div className={`carousel-card ${bgClass}`} key={plan.id}>
                <div className="carousel-content">
                  <h3 className="carousel-plan-title">{plan.title}</h3>
                  <p className="carousel-plan-desc">{plan.description}</p>
                  <Link href="/services" className="carousel-button">
                    {t.button}
                  </Link>
                </div>
              </div>
            );
          })}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ServicePlanCarousel;

'use client';

import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef, useMemo } from 'react';
import Slider from 'react-slick';
import { useInView } from 'react-intersection-observer'; // âœ… Intersection Observer
import './ServicePlanCarousel.css';
import { translations } from './translations';
import Link from 'next/link';

const ServicePlanCarousel = ({ language = 'en' }) => {
  const [servicePlans, setServicePlans] = useState([]);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  const [error, setError] = useState('');
  const sliderRef = useRef(null);

  // âœ… Intersection Observer for title animation
  const { ref: titleRef, inView: titleInView } = useInView({
    threshold: 0.3,
    triggerOnce: true,
  });

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchData = async () => {
      setLoading(true);
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${language}`);
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch');
        const data = await res.json();
        setServicePlans(data);
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message || 'Error loading service plans');
      } finally {
        setLoading(false);
      }
    };
    fetchData();
  }, [language]);

  const sliderSettings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1040, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } },
    ],
  }), []);

  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext();
      }
    }, 2500);
    return () => clearInterval(interval);
  }, []);

  const t = translations[language] || translations.en;

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-loading">{t.loading}</p>;
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-error">Error: {error}</p>;
  if (servicePlans.length === 0) return <p className="carousel-empty">{t.empty}</p>;

  return (
    <div className="carousel-section">
      <h2
        ref={titleRef}
        className={`carousel-title ${titleInView ? 'animate' : ''}`}
      >
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...sliderSettings}>
        {servicePlans
          .sort((a, b) => a.order - b.order)
          .map((plan, index) => {
            const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`;
            return (
              <div className={`carousel-card ${bgClass}`} key={plan.id}>
                <div className="carousel-content">
                  <h3 className="carousel-plan-title">{plan.title}</h3>
                  <p className="carousel-plan-desc">{plan.description}</p>
                  <Link href="/services" className="carousel-button">
                    {t.button}
                  </Link>
                </div>
              </div>
            );
          })}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  );
};

export default ServicePlanCarousel;

Absolutely! Here's your fully updated ServicePlanCarousel.jsx file with:

  • âœ… Multilingual support via useLanguage() context

  • âœ… Translations loading properly for title, button, loading, empty

  • âœ… Service plans loaded based on selected language

  • âœ… Scroll-triggered title animation using IntersectionObserver

âœ… ServicePlanCarousel.jsx

jsx
'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './ServicePlanCarousel.css'
import { useLanguage } from '@/context/LanguageContext'

const ServicePlanCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [servicePlans, setServicePlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [animateTitle, setAnimateTitle] = useState(false)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)
  const sliderRef = useRef(null)

  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setServicePlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // Auto-slide logic
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext()
      }
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  // IntersectionObserver for animated title
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => setAnimateTitle(entry.isIntersecting),
      { threshold: 0.1 }
    )
    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => {
      if (titleRef.current) observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
    }
  }, [])

  const settings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      {
        breakpoint: 1040,
        settings: { slidesToShow: 2, slidesToScroll: 1 }
      },
      {
        breakpoint: 500,
        settings: { slidesToShow: 1, slidesToScroll: 1 }
      }
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <div className='carousel-loading'>{t.loading}</div>
  if (error) return <div className='carousel-error'>Error: {error}</div>
  if (servicePlans.length === 0) return <div className='carousel-empty'>{t.empty}</div>

  return (
    <div className='carusel-section-services'>
      <h2 ref={titleRef} className={`carousel-title ${animateTitle ? 'animate' : ''}`}>
        {t.title}
      </h2>
      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {servicePlans.map((plan, index) => (
          <div className='service-container-outer' key={plan.id}>
            <div className='service-container-inner'>
              <h2 className='title-of-service'>{plan.title}</h2>
              <p className='description-of-service'>{plan.description}</p>
              <Link href='/services' className='go-button'>
                {t.button}
              </Link>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  )
}

export default ServicePlanCarousel

jsx
'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './ServicePlanCarousel.css'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'

const ServicePlanCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [servicePlans, setServicePlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [animateTitle, setAnimateTitle] = useState(false)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)
  const sliderRef = useRef(null)

  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setServicePlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // Auto-slide logic
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext()
      }
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  // Animate title when in view
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => setAnimateTitle(entry.isIntersecting),
      { threshold: 0.1 }
    )
    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => {
      if (titleRef.current) observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
    }
  }, [])

  const settings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1040, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 500, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } },
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <div className='service-carousel-loading'>{t.loading}</div>
  if (error) return <div className='service-carousel-error'>Error: {error}</div>
  if (servicePlans.length === 0) return <div className='service-carousel-empty'>{t.empty}</div>

  return (
    <div className='service-carousel-section'>
      <h2 ref={titleRef} className={`service-carousel-title ${animateTitle ? 'animate' : ''}`}>
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {servicePlans.map((plan, index) => (
          <div
            className={`service-carousel-card bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`}
            key={plan.id}
          >
            <div className='service-carousel-content'>
              <h2 className='service-carousel-plan-title'>{plan.title}</h2>
              <p className='service-carousel-plan-desc'>{plan.description}</p>
              <Link href='/services' className='service-carousel-button'>
                {t.button}
              </Link>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  )
}

export default ServicePlanCarousel

jsx
'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './ServiceCarousel.css'

const ServiceCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  const [plans, setPlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [animateTitle, setAnimateTitle] = useState(false)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)
  const sliderRef = useRef(null)

  // Fetch service plans by language
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setPlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // Auto-slide every 2.5s
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) sliderRef.current.slickNext()
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  // Animate title on scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => setAnimateTitle(entry.isIntersecting),
      { threshold: 0.1 }
    )
    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => {
      if (titleRef.current) observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
    }
  }, [])

  const sliderSettings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1040, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } },
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <div className="service-carousel-loading">{t.loading}</div>
  if (error) return <div className="service-carousel-error">Error: {error}</div>
  if (plans.length === 0) return <div className="service-carousel-empty">{t.empty}</div>

  return (
    <div className="service-carousel-section">
      <h2 ref={titleRef} className={`service-carousel-title ${animateTitle ? 'animate' : ''}`}>
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...sliderSettings}>
        {plans.map((plan, index) => (
          <div className={`service-carousel-card bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`} key={plan.id}>
            <div className="service-carousel-content">
              <h3 className="service-carousel-plan-title">{plan.title}</h3>
              <p className="service-carousel-plan-desc">{plan.description}</p>
              <Link href="/services" className="service-carousel-button">
                {t.button}
              </Link>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  )
}

export default ServiceCarousel

ChatGPT said:

You're absolutely right â€” that tells us the IntersectionObserver is not properly triggering the animation.

Letâ€™s go step-by-step to fix and bulletproof this ðŸ‘‡

âœ… 1. Fix the Intersection Observer Reference Timing

ðŸ” Problem:

If the ref isn't attached yet when the observer runs, or the component mounts too fast, the observer might miss the element.

âœ… Solution:

Add a setTimeout delay to ensure the ref is attached and the layout is ready:

js
useEffect(() => {
  const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
    ([entry]) => setAnimateTitle(entry.isIntersecting),
    { threshold: 0.1 }
  )

  const timeout = setTimeout(() => {
    if (titleRef.current) {
      observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    }
  }, 100) // delay ensures DOM is painted

  return () => {
    clearTimeout(timeout)
    if (titleRef.current) {
      observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
    }
  }
}, [])

âœ… 2. Ensure the Title is Visibly Entering the Viewport

If the title is too high on the page, it might already be out of the viewport when observed. Either:

  • Add temporary margin to push it into view:

    css
    .carusel-section-services {
  margin-top: 100px;
}

  • Or lower the threshold to be more sensitive:

    js
    { threshold: 0 }

âœ… 3. Add a Debug Log (Optional)

You can test if the observer is firing:

js
useEffect(() => {
  const observer = new IntersectionObserver(([entry]) => {
    console.log('Is intersecting:', entry.isIntersecting)
    setAnimateTitle(entry.isIntersecting)
  }, { threshold: 0 })

  if (titleRef.current) {
    observer.observe(titleRef.current)
  }

  return () => {
    if (titleRef.current) observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
  }
}, [])

If you donâ€™t see the console log, the observer isnâ€™t firing = viewport/layout issue.

âœ… 4. Final CSS Check

Make sure your animation classes are correct:

css
.carousel-title {
  opacity: 0;
  transform: translateY(50px);
  transition: all 1.5s ease-in-out;
}

.carousel-title.animate {
  opacity: 1;
  transform: translateY(0);
}

And in JSX:

jsx
<h2 ref={titleRef} className={`carousel-title ${animateTitle ? 'animate' : ''}`}>
  {t.title}
</h2>

// Title Animation on Scroll
useEffect(() => {
  const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
    ([entry]) => {
      if (entry.isIntersecting) {
        setAnimateTitle(true);
        observer.disconnect(); // disconnect after first animation
      }
    },
    { threshold: 0.2 } // 20% visible triggers animation
  );

  if (titleRef.current) {
    observer.observe(titleRef.current);
  }

  return () => {
    observer.disconnect();
  };
}, []);

âœ… ServiceCarousel.jsx

jsx
'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './ServiceCarousel.css'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'

const ServiceCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [servicePlans, setServicePlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [animateTitle, setAnimateTitle] = useState(false)

  const titleRef = useRef(null)
  const sliderRef = useRef(null)

  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  // Fetch service plans based on language
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setServicePlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // Auto-slide logic
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext()
      }
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  // Animate title on scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        if (entry.isIntersecting) {
          setAnimateTitle(true)
          observer.disconnect()
        }
      },
      { threshold: 0.2 }
    )

    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)

    return () => observer.disconnect()
  }, [])

  // Slider settings
  const settings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      {
        breakpoint: 1040,
        settings: { slidesToShow: 2, slidesToScroll: 1 }
      },
      {
        breakpoint: 500,
        settings: { slidesToShow: 1, slidesToScroll: 1 }
      }
    ]
  }), [])

  // Loading/Error/Empty states
  if (loading) return <div className='carousel-loading'>{t.loading}</div>
  if (error) return <div className='carousel-error'>Error: {error}</div>
  if (servicePlans.length === 0) return <div className='carousel-empty'>{t.empty}</div>

  return (
    <div className='carousel-section'>
      <h2
        ref={titleRef}
        className={`carousel-title ${animateTitle ? 'animate' : ''}`}
      >
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {servicePlans.map((plan, index) => {
          const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`

          return (
            <div className={`carousel-card ${bgClass}`} key={plan.id}>
              <div className='carousel-content'>
                <h2 className='carousel-plan-title'>{plan.title}</h2>
                <p className='carousel-plan-desc'>{plan.description}</p>
                <Link href='/services' className='carousel-button'>
                  {t.button}
                </Link>
              </div>
            </div>
          )
        })}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  )
}

export default ServiceCarousel

Let me know if you also want the most up-to-date CSS file version in the same format for cross-checking.

Those [Violation] warnings you're seeing in the console aren't errors â€” they are performance warnings logged by Chrome DevTools. Here's what they mean and whether you should worry:

âš ï¸ What do these messages mean?

  • [Violation] 'message' handler took xxxms
    This means a JavaScript event listener (like a scroll, resize, or message handler) took longer than the recommended 50ms, potentially causing UI lag.

  • [Violation] Forced reflow while executing JavaScript
    The browser was forced to recalculate styles and layout while JS was running â€” this can block smooth animations or interactions.

ðŸ§  Why it might be happening:

In your case, a few parts may contribute:

  1. The slider carousel (like react-slick) is animation-heavy and often triggers layout reflows.

  2. Title intersection observer + animation might cause DOM recalculations.

  3. Multiple renders or state updates can stack up when sliderRef.current.slickNext() is called every 2.5s.

AreaSuggestion
Auto-slide intervalSlightly increase interval (e.g., 3000ms) to ease CPU load.
IntersectionObserverDisconnect it after animation starts (you already do this â€” good job!).
Heavy CSSAvoid expensive properties like box-shadow, unnecessary transform, or nesting if possible.
Use will-changeYou're using will-change on .carousel-title â€” that's great! Apply it only where needed.
Test in production buildRun npm run build && npm start and test performance â€” warnings are usually fewer in optimized builds.

ðŸŸ¢ Final note

You're safe to ignore these during development unless the UI feels slow or laggy. These warnings are common when using sliders or scroll-based effects â€” and React Dev builds are slower by nature.

'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './ServiceCarousel.css'

const ServiceCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [plans, setPlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [titleVisible, setTitleVisible] = useState(false)

  const sliderRef = useRef(null)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)

  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setPlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        if (entry.isIntersecting) setTitleVisible(true)
      },
      { threshold: 0.4 }
    )

    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => {
      if (titleRef.current) observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
    }
  }, [])

  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext()
      }
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  const settings = useMemo(
    () => ({
      dots: true,
      infinite: true,
      speed: 600,
      slidesToShow: 3,
      slidesToScroll: 1,
      arrows: false,
      responsive: [
        { breakpoint: 1024, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
        { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } },
      ]
    }),
    []
  )

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.loading}</p>
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-status">Error: {error}</p>
  if (!plans.length) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.empty}</p>

  return (
    <section className="carousel-section">
      <h2
        ref={titleRef}
        className={`carousel-title ${titleVisible ? 'animate' : ''}`}
      >
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {plans.map((plan, index) => {
          const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`
          return (
            <div key={plan.id} className={`carousel-card ${bgClass}`}>
              <div className="carousel-content">
                <h3 className="carousel-plan-title">{plan.title}</h3>
                <p className="carousel-plan-desc">{plan.description}</p>
                <Link href="/services" className="carousel-button">
                  {t.button}
                </Link>
              </div>
            </div>
          )
        })}
      </Slider>
    </section>
  )
}

export default ServiceCarousel

'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './ServiceCarousel.css'

const ServiceCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [plans, setPlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [titleVisible, setTitleVisible] = useState(false)

  const sliderRef = useRef(null)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)

  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  // Fetch service plans
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setPlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // Animate title
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => setTitleVisible(entry.isIntersecting),
      { threshold: 0.2 }
    )
    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => titleRef.current && observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
  }, [])

  // Auto-slide every 2.5s
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) sliderRef.current.slickNext()
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  const settings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 600,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1024, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } }
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.loading}</p>
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-status">Error: {error}</p>
  if (!plans.length) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.empty}</p>

  return (
    <section className="carousel-section">
      <div ref={titleRef} className={`carousel-title ${titleVisible ? 'animate' : ''}`}>
        {t.title}
      </div>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {plans.map((plan, index) => {
          const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`
          return (
            <div key={plan.id} className={`carousel-card ${bgClass}`}>
              <div className="carousel-content">
                <h3 className="carousel-plan-title">{plan.title}</h3>
                <p className="carousel-plan-desc">{plan.description}</p>
                <Link href="/services" className="carousel-button">
                  {t.button}
                </Link>
              </div>
            </div>
          )
        })}
      </Slider>
    </section>
  )
}

ChatGPT said:

Absolutely! Here's your fully updated and optimized JSX component that works seamlessly with the CSS file you provided. It ensures:

âœ… Correct class names to match your CSS
âœ… Smooth IntersectionObserver animation on the title
âœ… Clean background cycling per card (bg-1, bg-2, bg-3)
âœ… Auto-slide every 2.5 seconds
âœ… Language-based service plan fetching with translations
âœ… No styling conflicts or unnecessary re-renders

âœ… ServiceCarousel.jsx

jsx
'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './ServiceCarousel.css'

const ServiceCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [plans, setPlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [titleVisible, setTitleVisible] = useState(false)

  const sliderRef = useRef(null)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)

  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  // Fetch service plans
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setPlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // Animate title on scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => setTitleVisible(entry.isIntersecting),
      { threshold: 0.3 }
    )
    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => titleRef.current && observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
  }, [])

  // Auto-slide every 2.5 seconds
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) {
        sliderRef.current.slickNext()
      }
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  const settings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 600,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1024, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } }
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.loading}</p>
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-status">Error: {error}</p>
  if (!plans.length) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.empty}</p>

  return (
    <section className="carusel-section-services">
      <h2
        ref={titleRef}
        className={`animated-title ${titleVisible ? 'animate' : ''}`}
      >
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {plans.map((plan, index) => {
          const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`

          return (
            <div key={plan.id} className={`service-container-outer ${bgClass}`}>
              <div className="service-container-inner">
                <h3 className="title-of-service">{plan.title}</h3>
                <p className="description-of-service">{plan.description}</p>
                <Link href="/services" className="go-button">
                  {t.button}
                </Link>
              </div>
            </div>
          )
        })}
      </Slider>
    </section>
  )
}

export default ServiceCarousel

jsx
'use client'

import React, { useState, useEffect, useMemo, useRef } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'
import './servicepreview.css'

const ServicesPreview = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [services, setServices] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [titleVisible, setTitleVisible] = useState(false)

  const sliderRef = useRef(null)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)

  // Fetch service plans by language
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchServices = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch services')
        const data = await res.json()
        setServices(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchServices()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // Animate title on scroll
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => setTitleVisible(entry.isIntersecting),
      { threshold: 0.1 }
    )
    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => titleRef.current && observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
  }, [])

  // Auto-slide every 2s
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) sliderRef.current.slickNext()
    }, 2000)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  const sliderSettings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 500,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1040, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 500, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } }
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-status">Loading services...</p>
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-status">Error: {error}</p>
  if (!services.length) return <p className="carousel-status">No services available.</p>

  // Translated title and button text
  const titleText = {
    es: 'Explora Nuestros Servicios Especiales para Ti',
    el: 'Î‘Î½Î±ÎºÎ±Î»ÏÏˆÏ„Îµ Ï„Î¹Ï‚ Î¥Ï€Î·ÏÎµÏƒÎ¯ÎµÏ‚ Î¼Î±Ï‚ Ï€Î¿Ï… Î£Ï‡ÎµÎ´Î¹Î¬ÏƒÏ„Î·ÎºÎ±Î½ Î³Î¹Î± Î•ÏƒÎ¬Ï‚',
    en: 'Explore Our Exceptional Services Designed Just for You'
  }

  const buttonText = {
    es: 'Ir al Servicio',
    el: 'Î Î®Î³Î±Î¹Î½Îµ ÏƒÏ„Î·Î½ Î¥Ï€Î·ÏÎµÏƒÎ¯Î±',
    en: 'Go To Service'
  }

  return (
    <div className="carusel-section-services">
      <h2
        ref={titleRef}
        className={`animated-title ${titleVisible ? 'animate' : ''}`}
      >
        {titleText[selectedLanguage] || titleText.en}
      </h2>

      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...sliderSettings}>
        {services.map((service, index) => (
          <div className="service-container-outer" key={service.id}>
            <div className="service-container-inner">
              <h2 className="title-of-service">{service.title}</h2>
              <p className="description-of-service">{service.description}</p>
              <Link href="/services" className="go-button">
                {buttonText[selectedLanguage] || buttonText.en}
              </Link>
            </div>
          </div>
        ))}
      </Slider>
    </div>
  )
}

export default ServicesPreview

  • Loads translated title and button based on selected language

  • Supports auto-sliding, responsiveness, and smooth transitions

ChatGPT said:

Thanks for sharing the full CSS. Based on the full analysis of your styles and current ServiceCarousel structure, the reason your title animation is not visible is likely due to either:

âœ… 1. CSS selector mismatch or incorrect class structure

Youâ€™re using:

css
.carusel-section-services .animated-title { ... }

But in your JSX, you might not be matching that structure.
If your title is not a child inside .carusel-section-services, the CSS will not apply.

âœ… 2. Wrong or missing class name in JSX

Make sure your JSX title has this exact structure:

jsx
<div className="carusel-section-services">
  <h2 ref={titleRef} className={`animated-title ${titleVisible ? 'animate' : ''}`}>
    {titleText[selectedLanguage]}
  </h2>
</div>

This way, the selector .carusel-section-services .animated-title will match correctly.

âœ… 3. Conflict or override from other animation logic

Your Hero and ConceptSection components are using .fade-in, .fade-in-up, .fade-in-left, etc. These may override or conflict if applied globally (e.g., via * selector or common animation classes).

Make sure you are not applying global styles like .animate {} that override the intended transition.

âœ… 4. IntersectionObserver not triggering

Ensure this logic works correctly:

js
useEffect(() => {
  const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
    ([entry]) => setTitleVisible(entry.isIntersecting),
    { threshold: 0.2 }
  );
  if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current);
  return () => titleRef.current && observer.unobserve(titleRef.current);
}, []);

Make sure:

  • titleRef is attached to the <h2 className="animated-title">

  • titleVisible is toggling between false and true

  • No rendering error prevents the title from mounting

âœ… 5. Slick overwriting layout / structure

Sometimes, the Slick carousel pushes layout changes that affect surrounding content. If you placed the title inside the Slider component, move it outside the <Slider>.

âœ… Recommended FIXED JSX Structure

Here is the correct structure that matches your CSS exactly:

jsx
<section className="carusel-section-services">
  <h2
    ref={titleRef}
    className={`animated-title ${titleVisible ? 'animate' : ''}`}
  >
    {titleText[selectedLanguage]}
  </h2>

  <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...sliderSettings}>
    {services.map((service) => (
      <div className="service-container-outer" key={service.id}>
        <div className="service-container-inner">
          <h2 className="title-of-service">{service.title}</h2>
          <p className="description-of-service">{service.description}</p>
          <Link href="/services" className="go-button">
            {buttonText[selectedLanguage]}
          </Link>
        </div>
      </div>
    ))}
  </Slider>
</section>

Make sure:

  • The h2.animated-title is direct child of .carusel-section-services

  • The CSS selector .carusel-section-services .animated-title is valid

  • Youâ€™re not importing any conflicting .animate class from Hero or ConceptsSection

âœ… Fixes & Enhancements:

  • Correct console.log placement (your current one is inside the IntersectionObserver config object, which is invalid).

âœ… Updated ServiceCarousel.jsx

jsx
'use client'

import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState, useMemo } from 'react'
import Slider from 'react-slick'
import Link from 'next/link'
import { useLanguage } from '../../../context/LanguageContext'
import { translations } from './translations'
import './Servicecarousel.css'

const ServiceCarousel = () => {
  const { selectedLanguage } = useLanguage()
  const [plans, setPlans] = useState([])
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true)
  const [error, setError] = useState(null)
  const [titleVisible, setTitleVisible] = useState(false)

  const sliderRef = useRef(null)
  const titleRef = useRef(null)

  const t = translations[selectedLanguage] || translations.en

  // âœ… Log visibility status changes
  useEffect(() => {
    console.log('ðŸ” Title visibility changed:', titleVisible)
  }, [titleVisible])

  // âœ… Fetch service plans
  useEffect(() => {
    const fetchPlans = async () => {
      try {
        const res = await fetch(`/api/service-plans?lang=${selectedLanguage}`)
        if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Failed to fetch service plans')
        const data = await res.json()
        setPlans(data)
      } catch (err) {
        setError(err.message)
      } finally {
        setLoading(false)
      }
    }

    fetchPlans()
  }, [selectedLanguage])

  // âœ… Animate title using IntersectionObserver
  useEffect(() => {
    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
      ([entry]) => {
        console.log('ðŸ“¡ Intersection observed:', entry.isIntersecting)
        setTitleVisible(entry.isIntersecting)
      },
      { threshold: 0.2 }
    )
    if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)
    return () => titleRef.current && observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
  }, [])

  // âœ… Auto-slide every 2.5s
  useEffect(() => {
    const interval = setInterval(() => {
      if (sliderRef.current) sliderRef.current.slickNext()
    }, 2500)
    return () => clearInterval(interval)
  }, [])

  const settings = useMemo(() => ({
    dots: true,
    infinite: true,
    speed: 600,
    slidesToShow: 3,
    slidesToScroll: 1,
    arrows: false,
    responsive: [
      { breakpoint: 1024, settings: { slidesToShow: 2 } },
      { breakpoint: 600, settings: { slidesToShow: 1 } }
    ]
  }), [])

  if (loading) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.loading}</p>
  if (error) return <p className="carousel-status">Error: {error}</p>
  if (!plans.length) return <p className="carousel-status">{t.empty}</p>

  return (
    <section className="carusel-section-services">
      {/* âœ… Title with animation */}
      <h2 ref={titleRef} className={`animated-title ${titleVisible ? 'animate' : ''}`}>
        {t.title}
      </h2>

      {/* âœ… Slider with service cards */}
      <Slider ref={sliderRef} {...settings}>
        {plans.map((plan, index) => {
          const bgClass = `bg-${(index % 3) + 1}`
          return (
            <div key={plan.id} className={`service-container-outer ${bgClass}`}>
              <div className="service-container-inner">
                <h2 className="title-of-service">{plan.title}</h2>
                <p className="description-of-service">{plan.description}</p>
                <Link href="/services" className="go-button">
                  {t.button}
                </Link>
              </div>
            </div>
          )
        })}
      </Slider>
    </section>
  )
}

export default ServiceCarousel

Thanks for sharing this output â€” what you're seeing isn't actually an error from your code. Thatâ€™s the React Scheduler development file, and it's not the root cause of your issue.

âœ… Here's what's actually happening:

  • The file you're referencing (scheduler.development.js) is part of React's internal libraries.

  • The warning about "Violation" 'message' handler took Xms means:

    • Your JavaScript is blocking the main thread for too long.

    • It likely comes from heavy re-renders, animations, or console logs during scroll or interaction.

âœ… What to do about it:

1. Check your animation triggers

If you placed a console.log() inside the animation logic (like in your IntersectionObserver), it could cause performance hiccups on scroll.

Fix:
Avoid logging on every scroll intersection. Instead, throttle it or log only once.

Example:

js
useEffect(() => {
  const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
    ([entry]) => {
      if (entry.isIntersecting) {
        console.log('ðŸ‘€ Title is visible, triggering animation!')
        setTitleVisible(true)
      }
    },
    { threshold: 0.2 }
  )

  if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)

  return () => titleRef.current && observer.unobserve(titleRef.current)
}, [])

2. Ensure the animation only happens once

Sometimes repeated animation triggers lead to this problem. Try making the observer disconnect after the first animation:

js
useEffect(() => {
  const observer = new IntersectionObserver(
    ([entry]) => {
      if (entry.isIntersecting) {
        setTitleVisible(true)
        observer.disconnect() // ðŸ” Stops observing after animation triggers
      }
    },
    { threshold: 0.2 }
  )
  if (titleRef.current) observer.observe(titleRef.current)

  return () => observer.disconnect()
}, [])

3. Reduce over-rendering

If your component fetches a lot or uses large state updates, keep your render logic lean. Avoid updating the DOM unnecessarily.

âœ… Conclusion

You're not seeing an actual JS error â€” you're seeing performance warnings.

To fix:

  • Clean up console.log() inside observers.

  • Prevent animation from repeatedly triggering.

  • Use observer.disconnect() after animation.
